Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland comes into a matchup against Oklahoma City as winners of 10 consecutive games.
The Cavaliers have gone 18-1 at home. Cleveland is second in the league averaging 122.5 points and is shooting 50.4% from the field.
The Thunder are 13-3 in road games. Oklahoma City is 26-5 when it has fewer turnovers than its opponents and averages 11.1 turnovers per game.

The 122.5 points per game the Cavaliers score are 19.5 more points than the Thunder allow (103.0). The Thunder average 115.1 points per game, 4.4 more than the 110.7 the Cavaliers give up to opponents.
Donovan Mitchell is scoring 23.3 points per game with 4.4 rebounds and 4.6 assists for the Cavaliers.
Jalen Williams is averaging 20.6 points, 5.8 rebounds, 5.1 assists and 1.8 steals for the Thunder.

In the last 10 games, the Cavaliers are 10-0, averaging 125.2 points, 45.6 rebounds, 31.8 assists, 8.8 steals and 4.8 blocks per game while shooting 49.5% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 108.6 points per game.

In the last 10 games, the Thunder are 10-0, averaging 113.9 points, 43.7 rebounds, 25.9 assists, 10.8 steals and 5.2 blocks per game while shooting 47.5% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 101.7 points.
Others: Injuries for Cavaliers: Sam Merrill: day to day (ankle), Isaac Okoro: out (shoulder).
Injuries for Thunder: Chet Holmgren: out (hip), Nikola Topic: out for season (acl), Alex Caruso: day to day (hip).
